title: [4/24/2017] PB&M Moderation
body:
Hello PB&M!

We’re going to be experimenting with player moderation within the Player Behavior & Moderation space which means the Arbiters will be assisting with fostering and maintaining this sub-board.

Actions include closing discussions and providing reasons for those decisions (transparency), as well as deleting discussions and comments as needed. You can still report in the [Boards Moderation Discord](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/ZfE311GQ-discord-verification) within the #pbmreports channel, and Arbiters will be able to assist you as available.

I’ll be monitoring this initiative closely over the coming weeks. I strongly encourage you to share feedback you have throughout this process.

replies.body: I'm the only the non blue name in this thread so far, send help

I'm kinda excited for this. The Arbiters are some of the nicest people in this community if you ask me. Keep up the good work guys!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
You're a cutie patootie! Thank you for the kind words ^^

If I may make a suggestion: please implement some kind of icon that indicates that a thread is locked on the thread select screen. Many other forums do this so I see no reason why this can't be done for the official Riot forums as well.
I gotchu! Thanks for the feedback!

Well let's look at the guidelines:

> This board is all about fostering a healthy community in which discussions can revolve around 

> player behavior systems

Riot is the only ones that know how the systems work (arbiters do not know). They don't like to talk about the details. Pretty much just leaves suggestions for future systems. Which Riot doesn't like to talk about.

>  in-game suspensions

What is there to talk about? Even unjustly punished people are told their punishments are just. Riot has an iron fist. 

>  or boards moderation

So we complain about moderation, to the moderators? 

`
Are you getting ready to fire forum moderators? I don't see how this subsection is overly populated enough to warrant volunteer moderation.

That is correct. You've been able to do so for a while now - the Discord channel has been available for anyone to join, provided you follow the instructions. This part has not changed and will continue to be a valid medium for you to bring forth any concerns surrounding moderation.

I think arbiters should have the ability to highlight or pin a comment that they deem informative or helpful for the topic poster to more easily view, as well as anyone that could potentially be missinformed by the post

We do. We just don't use it much, probably because we're all new to the system. The biggest thing we're dealing with right now is making sure what we delete and what we passively support by allowing it to stay leads to a healthy, vibrant community.
That explains how Wuks was able to close a thread I read earlier. All I can say is that it's about dang time that the moderation for this sub-forum starts stepping up. Hopefully this all goes well.
Just saw the lock icon for the first time. Thanks for implementing my suggestion.
I am very happy to being chat banned 2x in a row for defending myself, these arbiters should consider the background of non-friendly behaviour of each player to reach justice.
